content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>CEHTP Science Team</origin> <pubdate>20140624</pubdate> <title>Birth defects data for 8 California counties by county, maternal age, maternal race/ethnicity, and infant gender for the years 2000-2010.</title> <onlink>http://www.ehib.org/page.jsp?page_key=461</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>This dataset contains counts, rates, and confidence intervals of 12 selected birth defects among live births during 2000-2010 within eight California counties: Fresno, Kern, Kings, Madera, Merced, San Joaquin, Stanislaus, and Tulare.  The data are aggregated into 5-year intervals.  The data are stratified by county of residence, maternal age , maternal race/ethnicity and infant gender.  The data are from an active surveillance system that ascertains birth defects among live births, fetal deaths, and terminations, using ICD-9 codes.  </abstract> <purpose>To provide data that is consistent with the National Environmental Public Health Tracking Network guidance for creating Nationally Consistent Data and Measures (NCDMs) for birth defects.</purpose> <supplinf>These data were provided by the California Birth Defects Monitoring Program (CBDMP).  The data have been aggregated to protect patient confidentiality. </supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <rngdates> <begdate>20000101</begdate> <begtime/> <enddate>20101231</enddate> <endtime/> </rngdates> </timeinfo> <current>Publication Date</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>None planned</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-124.409721</westbc> <eastbc>-114.131208</eastbc> <northbc>42.009521999999997</northbc> <southbc>32.53416</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>Adverse Event Consequence - CDC</themekt> <themekey>Anencephaly, Spina bifida, Hypospadias, Gastrochisis, Cleft lip, Cleft palate, Upper limb deficiency, Lower limb deficiency, Down syndrome, Trisomy 21, Tetralogy of Fallot , Hypoplastic left heart syndrome, Transposition of the great arteries (vessels)</themekey> </theme> <theme> <themekt>NONE</themekt> <themekey>Surveillance, Environmental Health Tracking Program, EPHT, Environmental Health</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekt>FIPS 5-2 (State)</placekt> <placekey>California, CA, 06</placekey> </place> <place> <placekt>FIPS 6-4 (County)</placekt> <placekey>Fresno, 06019, Kern, 06029, Kings, 06031, Madera, 06039, Merced, 06047, San Joaquin, 06077, Stanislaus, 06099, Tulare 06107</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>Request for restricted (secure) data must be made directly to the California Birth Defects Monitoring Program (CBDMP). This will include an application for the release of restricted data, a research protocol and proof of approval by, or exemption from, an Institutional Review Board (IRB) formed and maintained in accordance with the U.S. Dept. of Health and Human Services Code of Federal Regulations for Protection of Human Subjects (45 CFR 46, revised March 8, 1983).  The California Committee for the Protection of Human Subjects serves as the institutional review board (IRB) for the California Health and Human Services Agency.</accconst> <useconst>This information is provided by the California Environmental Health Tracking Program (CEHTP) and the California Birth Defects Monitoring Program (CBDMP) in the California Department of Public Health.  Efforts have been made to assure the accuracy of the data.  However, no responsibility is assumed by CEHTP or CBDMP, related to materials or how it is represented by those who access this information.  All users must read and fully comprehend metadata prior to data use.    Data will not be released, furnished, disclosed, published or otherwise disseminated to any person (except for employees under supervision of data requestor, who has agreed in writing to comply with these conditions), unless the data has been aggregated and all cell sizes less than 5 are suppressed.</useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>CEHTP Science Team</cntper> <cntorg>CA Department of Public Health, CA Environmental Health Tracking Program</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos/> <cntaddr> <addrtype>Mailing</addrtype> <address>850 Marina Bay Parkway, Bldg P, 3rd Floor</address> <city>Richmond</city> <state>CA</state> <postal>94804</postal> <country>United States Of America</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>5106203620</cntvoice> <cnttdd/> <cntfax>5106203720</cntfax> <cntemail>data@cehtp.org</cntemail> <hours/> <cntinst/> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <secinfo> <secsys>None</secsys> <secclass>Restricted</secclass> <sechandl>None</sechandl> </secinfo> <native>SAS v.9.1 </native> </idinfo> <dataqual> <logic>NA</logic> <complete>These data include selected birth defects from 8 California counties.  These data are based on ICD9-CM diagnosis codes. </complete> <lineage> <procstep> <procdesc>The California Birth Defects Monitoring Program (CBDMP) has been an active ascertainment, population based registry since 1982 when the California State Legislature authorized CBDMP to collect data on birth defects, stillbirths, and miscarriages.  CBDMP currently monitors a subset, over 40% of annual births in California, which represents the state\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds geographic, environmental and racial/ethnic diversity. The CBDMP registry data are used for ongoing surveillance to monitor rates and trends of select birth defects.   </procdesc> <procdate>20140624</procdate> </procstep> <procstep> <procdesc>CEHTP obtained data from CBDMP on 12 select birth defects aggregated by year of birth, county, maternal age, maternal race, maternal ethnicity, and infant gender.  CEHTP aggregated the data into 5-year intervals and created this dataset to be used for public health surveillance, while maintaining confidentiality.  This dataset on the CEHTP portal includes counts, rates, and confidence intervals for the 12 select birth defects by 5-year aggregation, county, and by one of the following demographic groups: maternal age, maternal race/ethnicity, and infant gender. Hypospadias counts and rates are available for male infants only, not for female infants or both sexes.  Trisomy 21 (Down Syndrome) counts and rates are available by all maternal ages combined, mothers less than 35 years old, and mothers greater than or equal to 35 years old. To calculate 5-year rates, we use birth data provided by CBDMP.  Confidence intervals for birth defect rates are calculated using the modified Wilson's score method (Croarkin C and Tobias P, Sect 7.2.4.1: Confidence Intervals. From NIST/SEMATECH Engineering Statistics Handbook, http://www.itl.nist.gov/div898/handbook/prc/section2/prc241.htm )</procdesc> <procdate>20140624</procdate> </procstep> </lineage> </dataqual> <eainfo> <overview> <eaover>This data contains the following fields: Cnty_FIPS Start_Date End_Date Measure_ID Measure_VA  Case counts are aggregated into 3 or 4-year intervals according to birth defect by county and one of the following: maternal age group, maternal race/ethnicity, and infant gender.</eaover> <eadetcit>Selected birth defects: Anencephaly Spina bifida without anencephaly Hypoplastic left heart syndrome Tetralogy of Fallot Transposition of the great arteries (vessels) Cleft lip with or without cleft palate Cleft palate without cleft lip Hypospadias Gastroschisis Upper limb deficiencies Lower limb deficiencies Trisomy 21</eadetcit> </overview> </eainfo> <distinfo> <distrib> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>CEHTP Science Team</cntper> <cntorg>CA Department of Public Health, CA Environmental Health Tracking Program</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos/> <cntaddr> <addrtype>Mailing</addrtype> <address>850 Marina Bay Parkway, Bldg P, 3rd Floor</address> <city>Richmond</city> <state>CA</state> <postal>94804</postal> <country>United States Of America</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>5106203620</cntvoice> <cnttdd/> <cntfax>5106203720</cntfax> <cntemail>data@cehtp.org</cntemail> <hours/> <cntinst/> </cntinfo> </distrib> <resdesc>NA</resdesc> <distliab>Persons or entities given access to restricted data are liable for compliance with conditions set forth in the data use agreement.  Disciplinary action will be incurred for non-compliance or violation of data use agreements.</distliab> <custom>For access to restricted or secure data please see Access contraints section for release of restricted data.</custom> </distinfo> <metainfo> <metd>20140624</metd> <metc> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>CEHTP Science Team</cntper> <cntorg>CA Department of Public Health, CA Environmental Health Tracking Program</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos/> <cntaddr> <addrtype>Mailing</addrtype> <address>850 Marina Bay Parkway, Bldg P, 3rd Floor</address> <city>Richmond</city> <state>CA</state> <postal>94804</postal> <country>United States Of America</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>5106203620</cntvoice> <cnttdd/> <cntfax>5106203720</cntfax> <cntemail>data@cehtp.org</cntemail> <hours/> <cntinst/> </cntinfo> </metc> <metstdn>EPHTN Tracking Network Profile Version 1.2</metstdn> <metac>None</metac> <metuc>None</metuc> </metainfo> </metadata>
